newsitem.title: POLAND: AILING ESPEBEPE EXTENDS THURSDAY'S DROP.
newsitem.headline: AILING ESPEBEPE EXTENDS THURSDAY'S DROP.

text.p: Polish construction firm Espebepe SA tumbled 9.6 percent to 5.15 zlotys after Thursday's news the largest creditor of the debt-ridden builder is against the debt-restructuring deal it proposed, traders said.
Espebepe, which fell 9.5 percent on Thursday before the news, wants its largest creditors to write off 95 percent of its 75-million-zloty debt and then issue new shares to them at five zlotys each.
Pomorski Bank Kredytowy SA (PBKS) is the largest of the firm's creditors, which are due to meet on May 16 to discuss the possible deal.
PBKS earlier proposed a 40-percent write-off of debts and a convertible bond issue in exchange for the remaining debt but Espebepe rejected the plan as too expensive and time-consuming.
Selling of the stock on Friday was strong enough after price-fixing to reduce players' bids.
